item.title: Delete this post
item.dc:creator: @LordDeth LordDeth
item.description:
@LordDeth wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:2, topic:409625”][quote][font=verdana][size=11pt]1.[/size][/font] All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server. Any non-server related questions will be locked. Requesting a host, ‘coder’/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server related. That means for other sections on this site too.

[size=11pt]2.[/size][size=13px] All topic bodies must follow this post.

[size=11pt]3.[/size][size=13px] We are not a Spoonfeeding community. We do not teach in an oversimplified manner to discourage independent thought. We encourage independent thought, meaning you must help yourselves before requesting help. Failure to provide some sort of prior knowledge or work to the problem will result in a lock of the topic. This is final.

[size=11pt]4.[/size][size=13px] Excessive spamming or flaming, as a rule of thumb, will result in one to two week warnings or moderations. Repetitive excessive flaming will result in worse punishments. This means, the more posts full of excessive flaming there are in the topics, the worse each punishment will be individually. Same applies to spamming.

[size=11pt]5.[/size][size=13px] Make sure the titles of your topics are easy to read and are completely relevant to the topic at hand. Though this rule may be bent from time to time, make sure you follow it. A moderator on a bad day could easily lock a topic for breaking this rule.

[size=11pt]6.[/size][size=13px] Advertising is strictly forbidden in this section AND all others. Multiple advertising will result in a mute or a ban as advertising is getting out of hand. Take it to the Server Status page located HERE.

[size=11pt]7.[/size][size=13px] Offering a reward for someones help is not allowed, help is free on this community. [/quote]

Read rule 1.[/quote]

Fair enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Delete this post
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[font=verdana][size=11pt][b]1.[/b][/size][/font] All topics in this section [b]must[/b] be requests for help on a [b]server[/b]. Any non-server related questions will be locked. [u]Requesting a host, 'coder'/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server related. That means for other sections on this site too.[/u]

[size=11pt]2.[/size][size=13px] All topic bodies must follow this post.

[size=11pt]3.[/size][size=13px] We are not a Spoonfeeding community. We do not teach in an oversimplified manner to discourage independent thought. We encourage independent thought, meaning you must help yourselves before requesting help. Failure to provide some sort of prior knowledge or work to the problem will result in a lock of the topic. This is final.

[size=11pt]4.[/size][size=13px] Excessive spamming or flaming, as a rule of thumb, will result in one to two week warnings or moderations. Repetitive excessive flaming will result in worse punishments. This means, the more posts full of excessive flaming there are in the topics, the worse each punishment will be individually. Same applies to spamming.

[size=11pt]5.[/size][size=13px] Make sure the titles of your topics are easy to read and are completely relevant to the topic at hand. Though this rule may be bent from time to time, make sure you follow it. A moderator on a bad day could easily lock a topic for breaking this rule.

[size=11pt]6.[/size][size=13px] Advertising is strictly forbidden in this section AND all others. Multiple advertising will result in a mute or a ban as advertising is getting out of hand. Take it to the Server Status page located HERE.

[size=11pt]7.[/size][size=13px] Offering a reward for someones help is not allowed, help is free on this community.

Read rule 1.

Read full topic
